title: Installation issue: moab
body:
```console
$ spack spec moab
```
This command does not work on develop; it works on releases/v0.16 on my laptop
If I try this on my laptop (ubuntu 18.04) or on a workstation with ubuntu 14.04, I get this error; how do I track which one is the dependency that is troublesome for blas/openblas/flexiblas lapack?
```console
$ spack spec moab
Input spec
--------------------------------
moab

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: Conflicts in concretized spec "moab@5.0.2%gcc@7.5.0~cgm+coupler~dagmc~debug~fbigeom+fortran+hdf5~irel+metis+mpi~netcdf+parmetis~pnetcdf~shared~zoltan arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake/7apj6yy"

List of matching conflicts for spec:

    openblas@0.3.12%gcc@7.5.0~consistent_fpcsr~ilp64+pic+shared threads=none arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake

1. "%gcc@:8.2.99" conflicts with "openblas@0.3.11:"
```
Actually, I have this on my laptop
```console
$ spack spec blas
Input spec
--------------------------------
blas

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: Conflicts in concretized spec "openblas@0.3.12%gcc@7.5.0~consistent_fpcsr~ilp64+pic+shared threads=none arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake/ewrbb3x"

List of matching conflicts for spec:

    openblas@0.3.12%gcc@7.5.0~consistent_fpcsr~ilp64+pic+shared threads=none arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake

1. "%gcc@:8.2.99" conflicts with "openblas@0.3.11:"
```
So "blas" itself is not building ? How do I read this ?
